intro: Paracalyx microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved paracalyx, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
